alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Carteret; Craven; Dare; Hyde; Jones; Onslow; Pamlico; Tyrrell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 12 at 10:24AM EST until March 12 at 10:45AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EST FOR SOUTHEASTERN JONES...SOUTHEASTERN CRAVEN...HYDE...DARE...CENTRAL ONSLOW...SOUTHEASTERN BEAUFORT...SOUTHEASTERN TYRRELL...CARTERET AND PAMLICO COUNTIES... At 1023 AM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Sladesville to near Fairfield Harbour to near Verona, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, New Bern, Havelock, Morehead City, North Topsail Beach, Newport, Kill Devil Hills, Stumpy Point, Cedar Island, Frisco, Harkers Island, Camp Lejeune Center, Piney Green, Stella, Southern Shores, Swansboro, Hubert, South River, Cape Carteret and North River. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM EST for eastern North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889.

area.areaDesc: Beaufort; Carteret; Craven; Dare; Hyde; Jones; Onslow; Pamlico; Tyrrell
